title: Sri Lanka Treasury bill yields down
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Treasury bill yields fell across maturities at Wednesday’s auction with the 3-month yield falling 118 basis points to 20.73 percent, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office sold 67 billion rupees of 3-month bills after offering 45 billion.
The 6-month bill fell 99 basis points to 21.90 percent with 15.5 billion rupees of bills sold after offering 25 billion.
The 12-month yield fell 109 basis points with 15.4 billion rupees of bills sold.
The debt office sold all offered 98 billion rupees of bills. (Colombo/June015/2022)
